Name: Rectangular low aspect ratio concrete walls 18"-24" thick with double curtain and  heights  16' - 24'

GeneralInformation.Description: Costing for each 400 ft^2 Wall Panel, Orthogonal web reinforcement, f'c > 2500 psi, P/(A*f'c) <= 0.2
GeneralInformation.Author: Andrew Whittaker
GeneralInformation.Notes: Full repair description does not fully fit on sheet - consider shortening.  Description will fit in PACT.

DamageStates.Description: Cracks with maximum widths greater than 0.04 in but less than 0.12 in.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary) 5 feet either side of damaged area.  Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary).

DamageStates.Description: Crushed core concrete; localized concrete cracking with widths greater than 0.12 in; buckling of vertical rebar.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: (1) Relocate office eqpt & furniture within 6 ft. of wall, both sides. Install protective covers on floor finishes & adjacent curtain wall system.  (2) Remove arch. finishes on wall, both sides.  (3) Relocate MEP systems within 6 ft. of wall.  (4) Prepare & inject grout 330 ft. of crack per 100 ft2 of wall.  (5) Remove 15 ft2 per 100 ft2 of wall & 10 1-ft. long sections of #8 buckled vert. rebar.  (6) Replace buckled rebar with new rebar, attach to exposed ends of (E) rebar with mech splices; provide 8 #4 seismic ties at 4 in. oc, ea end of wall; re-bend 16 horiz. rebar in wall around new rebar.  (7) Install formwork & cast 5ksi concrete into pockets cut in step 5.  (8) Strip forms, clean-up, reinstall/return office eqpt., finishes, furniture & MEP.

DamageStates.Description: Sliding of the wall resulting in large residual displacement; distributed concrete cracking with widths greater than 0.12 in; fracture of rebar.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: (1) Relocate eqpt.& furniture within 10 ft. of wall, both sides. Install protection on floor & adjacent walls.  (2) Remove wall finishes, both sides.  (3) Relocate MEP within 10 ft. of wall.  (4) Remove damaged wall in 5-ft.lengths.  (5) Install bars: a. 12#9 A706 bars in bz ea. end; mech splices to (E) ; b. #4 A706 dbl sets of seismic ties at 4 in. oc ea bz; c. #4 A706 bar at 6 in. oc, ewef; lap new vert. bars to (E) at top of wall; drill & epoxy bars into wall/fdn at 6 in. oc to match new rebar above.  Anchor horiz.  Bars in bz with seismic hks or lap 24 in. with (E) horiz. bars.  (6) Form wall.  Cast 5ksi concrete in 3-ft. lifts; with 1-in. top gap for grout day after casting.  (7) Remove forms, clean-up & reinstall/return eqpt, finishes, furniture & MEP.
